questions.question: Two polarisers A and B are kept one after the other. Their pass axis makes an angle of 45 with each other. An unpolarized light of intensity I0 strikes A first and then B. Find the intensity of the light emergent from B.
questions.hint: Use Malus' Law after accounting for initial polarization by first polarizer (intensity becomes I0/2 after A).

questions.question: Simple pendulum of length 'l = 4' is taken to height 'R' above earth surface calculate time period at its height {R → Radius of Earth & Taken π² = g}
questions.hint: Time period formula at height h: T = 2π√(l/g'). Use g' = g(R/(R+h))² with h=R.

questions.question: If for a given planet RP = 1/3 RE & MP = 1/6 ME then find the escape speed for this planet if the escape speed of earth is 11.2 km/s
questions.hint: Use escape velocity formula v ∝ √(M/R). Calculate ratio (√(MP/ME × RE/RP)).

questions.question: Find value of P in the dimensional equation M¹ = [CP G⁻½ h½] where C = speed of light, G = gravitational constant, h = Planck's constant
questions.hint: Equate dimensions of both sides. Use [C] = LT⁻¹, [G] = M⁻¹L³T⁻², [h] = ML²T⁻¹.

questions.question: A block of mass 1 kg is pulled up on an inclined plane 60° by a force of 10 N. Coefficient of friction is µ = 0.1. Find the magnitude of Work done by the friction by the time block moves up by 10 m.
questions.hint: Calculate frictional force = µN. Find normal reaction N = mgcosθ. Multiply by displacement.

questions.question: Find the Tension T1 & T2 in the given system
questions.hint: Apply equilibrium conditions. Likely involves pulley system with multiple masses - use free body diagrams.
questions.image_description: System likely shows masses connected through pulleys with different tensions in ropes.

questions.question: Charge -q rotating around infinite long wire having charge density λ at distance r. Calculate the time period of that -q charge.
questions.hint: Balance centripetal force with electrostatic force. Electric field from wire E = 2kλ/r.

questions.question: 2 moles of monatomic gas (γ = 5/3) is mixed with 3 moles of diatomic gas (γ = 7/5). Find γ of the mixture.
questions.hint: Use formula γ_mix = (n1Cp1 + n2Cp2)/(n1Cv1 + n2Cv2). Calculate Cp and Cv for each gas first.
